abstract: One company interested in the stake is the U.S. telecommunications giant AT&T, which is in preliminary talks with Reliance.
snippet: One company interested in the stake is the U.S. telecommunications giant AT&T, which is in preliminary talks with Reliance.
lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI  Reliance Communications, one of the largest mobile-phone providers in India, with 106 million subscribers, plans to sell a 26 percent stake to raise cash to cover costs that include $1.8 billion for licenses for high-speed data services.

headline.main: Reliance of India Approves Plan to Sell a 26% Stake
headline.print_headline: Reliance of India Approves Plan to Sell a 26% Stake
